pullRequest.body:
Given a continuous bilinear map `B : E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] F ‚ÜíL[ùïú] G`, we define an associated map `ContinuousLinearMap.holder : Lp E p Œº ‚Üí Lp F q Œº ‚Üí Lp G r Œº` where `p q r` are a H√∂lder triple. We bundle this into a bilinear map `ContinuousLinearMap.holder‚Çó` and a continuous bilinear map `ContinuousLinearMap.holderL` under some additional assumptions.

We also declare a heterogeneous scalar multiplication (`HSMul`) instance on `MeasureTheory.Lp` spaces. Although this could use the `ContinuousLinearMap.holder` construction above, we opt not to do so in order to minimize the necessary type class assumptions.

When `p q : ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû` are H√∂lder conjugate (i.e., `HolderConjugate p q`), we also construct the natural map `ContinuousLinearMap.lpPairing : Lp E p Œº ‚ÜíL[ùïú] Lp F q Œº ‚ÜíL[ùïú] G` given by `fun f g ‚Ü¶ ‚à´ x, B (f x) (g x) ‚àÇŒº`.

Note: this makes the second example (the first being matrices) of a true heterogeneous (scalar, in this case) multiplication occurring in practice. Right now, none of our distributivity lemmas can be stated for in that context. Moreover, we can't have `IsScalarTower` or `SMulCommClass` instances for these.

---

- [x] depends on: #21792 
- [x] depends on: #21854  

This PR can be split once the design decisions are approved.

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [83d930757b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21583/commits/83d930757b9fe94d6e161f9618b40d7a4556d2da)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.Holder` (new file)|1967|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ add_smul`
`+ coeFn_holder`
`+ coeFn_lpSMul`
`+ holder`
`+ holderL`
`+ holder_add_left`
`+ holder_add_right`
`+ holder_smul_left`
`+ holder_smul_right`
`+ holder‚Çó`
`+ instance : HSMul (Lp ùïú p Œº) (Lp E q Œº) (Lp E r Œº)`
`+ lpPairing`
`+ lpPairing_eq_integral`
`+ neg_smul`
`+ neg_smul_neg`
`+ nnnorm_holder_apply_apply_le`
`+ norm_holderL_le`
`+ norm_holder_apply_apply_le`
`+ norm_smul_le`
`+ smul_add`
`+ smul_assoc`
`+ smul_comm`
`+ smul_def`
`+ smul_neg`
`+ smul_zero`
`+ zero_smul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Can you show the relationship to conjugate exponents?
`p q` are H√∂lder conjugate exponents if `HolderTriple 1 p q`. Is that your question?

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21792~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21854~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
This looks really nice, thanks!
This looks really nice, thanks!
Looks really good!

Should we use the simp-normal form here?
```suggestion
  inv_eq_add : r‚Åª¬π = p‚Åª¬π + q‚Åª¬π
```

What about even
```suggestion
  inv_add_inv : p‚Åª¬π + q‚Åª¬π = r‚Åª¬π
```

Yes, that seems preferable. I went with `/` originally just because of the statement of [MeasureTheory.Mem‚Ñíp.mul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Function/LpSeminorm/CompareExp.html#MeasureTheory.Mem%E2%84%92p.mul), so I'll probably change that while I'm at it.

```suggestion
protected lemma eq {p q r : ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû} [ENNReal.HolderTriple p q r] :
```

I think I prefer to think of it as a way to turn *any* pairing between Banach spaces into a pairing on the corresponding Lp spaces. The main reason is that it becomes easily iterable: if you have nested Lp spaces, you can just map the pairing through each layer iteratively.

This would give something like this (with the variables of the previous section):
```lean
variable (Œº p q) in
def _root_.ContinuousLinearMap.lpPairing [HolderTriple p q 1] 
    [NormedSpace ‚Ñù G] [SMulCommClass ‚Ñù ùïú G] [CompleteSpace G] (B : E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] F ‚ÜíL[ùïú] G) :
    Lp E p Œº ‚ÜíL[ùïú] Lp F q Œº ‚ÜíL[ùïú] G :=
  (L1.integralCLM' ùïú |>.postcomp <| Lp F q Œº) ‚àòL (B.holderL Œº p q 1)
```
Aren't you already in the `ContinuousLinearMap` namespace?

```suggestion
`fun œÜ f ‚Ü¶ ‚à´ x, œÜ x (f x) ‚àÇŒº`.
```
no?
That's a weird import to need here. `CompletePartialOrder` is domain theoretic

:fearful: Well that's *very* scary. On this commit 1f6d64fb841c128018fdb277b3e81a6caff6b1d1, running `#min_imports` at the bottom produces this list! And yet I can remove this import with no consequences! And `Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Basic` is also unnecessary! What is going on here?

It's simply typeclass search going through those files if they are imported, and avoiding them if they are not. There's a handful of files with that behaviour: the two you already mentioned, but also `Algebra.Lie.OfAssociative` and a few other ones.

My algorithm is to run `#min_imports`, then try replacing in turn each import by its imports.

I am trying to turn that algorithm into a code action for `#min_imports`.

```suggestion
protected lemma smul_left_comm [SMulCommClass ùïú' ùïú E]
```
That doesn't match `_root_.smul_comm`
It too is misnamed üò¢
For consistency, I'm leaving this as is.

```suggestion
protected lemma smul_assoc [IsScalarTower ùïú' ùïú E]
```
Doesn't match `_root_.smul_assoc` (or any other `assoc` lemma).
Sorry, but I disagree. It's the same shape as `_root_.smul_assoc`
oops! I read the diff backwards.
Should `r` be explicit in `holder` so as to avoid having to type-ascript `Lp G r Œº` everywhere?
I debated with myself about this, but I think you're right. I've made `r` explicit.

Let's make `lpSMul` a single token
```suggestion
lemma coe_lpSMul (f : Lp ùïú p Œº) (g : Lp E q Œº) :
```
Done, but I kept `coeFn` because in `MeasureTheory.Lp`, this is how we distinguish between `‚Üë` and `‚Üë‚Üë`.

pullRequest.title: feat: H√∂lder combinations of `MeasureTheory.Lp` functions, including heterogeneous scalar multiplication

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: allow for bilinear maps of norm greater than one in H√∂lder's inequality and use `HolderTriple`
